mdes.slick.sui
Class Button

java.lang.Object
  mdes.slick.sui.Component
      mdes.slick.sui.Container
          mdes.slick.sui.Label
              mdes.slick.sui.Button
Direct Known Subclasses:
Frame.CloseButton, SimpleArrowButton, ToggleButton
public class Button
extends Label

A basic, clickable button component. SuiButtons are rendered based on their state: UP, DOWN, or ROLLOVER. Images can be set for each state.

A button will be "hit" when the first mouse button is clicked and released over it (MouseEvent.BUTTON1).

All SuiButtons are created with a padding of 5, and with text and images initially centered.

Since:
b.0.1

Method Detail

updateAppearance

public void updateAppearance()
Description copied from class: Component

This method updates the appearance by retrieving it from the current skin.

This method is typically called from the constructor of a subclass. It is usually implemented in the following manner: 

public void updateAppearance() {
     setAppearance(Sui.getSkin().getXXXAppearance());
 }
Where getXXXAppearance represents the component appearance (such as getButtonAppearance).

Overrides:
updateAppearance in class Label

setVisible

public void setVisible(boolean b)
Description copied from class: Component
Sets the visibility for this component and all of its children. Invisible components are not rendered. If a component with the focus is hidden, the focus is released.

Overrides:
setVisible in class Component
Parameters:
b - true if it should be renderable

getImageForState

protected org.newdawn.slick.Image getImageForState(int state)
Determines the Image to draw based on the given state.

UP: getImage() if enabled, otherwise getDisabledImage() DOWN: getDownImage() if it exists, otherwise getImage() ROLLOVER: getRolloverImage() if it exists, otherwise getImage()

getState

public int getState()
Gets the current state of the button.

Returns:
the state id: either UP, DOWN, or ROLLOVER.
